name: Soul Edge
overview:
Soul Edge (ソウルエッジ) is a fighting game developed by the team Project Soul and published by Namco. Originally released as an arcade game in 1995, an upgraded and expanded version of the game was ported to the PlayStation in 1996.

One of the first breakthrough 3-D fighting games. You actually feel as though you are in control of the character due to the way the moves are set up. This is also one of the first 3-D games that allows you to move in directions other than forwards or backwards.

The game was a commercial and critical success and acts as the first installment in the Soul series, and was followed up with Soulcalibur in 1998.
